alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Walker (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 5:49PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Walker and central Jefferson Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 549 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Dora to near West Jefferson to 8 miles south of Gorgas Steam Plant. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Birmingham, Hoover, Vestavia Hills, Bessemer, Homewood, Mountain Brook, Hueytown, Irondale, Fairfield, Fultondale, Sumiton, Dora, Pleasant Grove, Tarrant, Midfield, Adamsville, Brighton, Lipscomb, Graysville and Sylvan Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
